title: Clark leaves with groin injury late in Fever win
content: Caitlin Clark was visibly emotional on the bench after suffering an apparent groin injury in the final minute of the Fever's win over the Sun on Tuesday night.

title: MLB recreates Aaron's record-breaking HR at ASG
content: Major League Baseball honored Hall of Famer Hank Aaron by recreating his 715th home run through projection mapping and pyrotechnics Tuesday night.

title: Sources: Jets' Gardner now NFL's highest-paid CB
content: Sauce Gardner and the Jets have agreed to a four-year, $120.4 extension, making him the NFL's highest-paid cornerback, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Chiefs, guard Smith reach historic deal
content: Pro Bowl guard Trey Smith and the Kansas City Chiefs reached agreement ahead of Tuesday's franchise-tag deadline on a four-year, $94 million deal that includes $70 million guaranteed, sources told ESPN.

title: Amid hype, Manning keen to 'play ball,' prove self
content: While the frenzy around Arch Manning continued at SEC media days, the Texas QB realizes he hasn't proved anything on the field in Austin as he readies for his first full season at the Longhorns' starter.

title: Rays, if in, get OK for playoffs in 10K-seat stadium
content: The Rays will play potential postseason games at Steinbrenner Field in Tampa, setting up the possibility of a World Series staged in a minor league stadium.

title: Schauffele offloads trophies, unsure where gold is
content: Xander Schauffele, who counts two majors and a Tour Championship among his victories, gives his trophies to his parents, and he's "not sure" where his Olympic gold medal is.

title: Dump bump: Raleigh's Derby victory lifts ratings
content: Cal Raleigh's Home Run Derby victory gave a boost to the ratings, as viewership was up 5% from 2024, according to Nielsen ratings.

title: Before he was the best golfer of his generation, Rory McIlroy was an East Tennessee State commit
content: Fred Warren was one of the first college coaches to recruit heavily from Europe. And he nearly snagged a young McIlroy.

title: Open Championship: Ranking the 25 players with the best chance to win
content: Can Scottie Scheffler add to his major total? Is Jon Rahm headed toward big things at Royal Portrush?

title: Ranking CFB's best coaches, from Ryan Day and Dabo Swinney to ... Rhett Lashlee?
content: Is Ryan Day a genius or could anyone win at Ohio State? We break down 20 years of sideline overachievers.

title: Best NFL teams of the past 25 years, ranked from 25 to 1
content: With 25 NFL seasons in the books since 2000, let's pick the 25 best teams. How many Patriots, Eagles and Chiefs squads make the list?

title: World Cup lessons from Club World Cup: Extreme weather, bad traffic, kickoff times, more
content: With the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup behind us, what issues emerged this summer that need to be addressed ahead of next summer's World Cup in the U.S., Mexico and Canada? Our reporters weigh in.

title: PSG's Dembélé is the front-runner to win the Ballon d'Or -- but who actually deserves it?
content: Now that PSG have lost the Club World Cup, the 2024-25 season is officially over and we can pick the Ballon d'Or for the best player. Who really deserves it?

title: Source: Liverpool make approach for striker Isak
content: Liverpool have registered their interest in signing Newcastle United forward Alexander Isak this summer as they continue their search for a No.9, a source has told ESPN.

title: Sources: Bellingham out 12 weeks post-surgery
content: Real Madrid midfielder Jude Bellingham will undergo surgery on his left shoulder in London on Wednesday, sources have told ESPN.

title: Sources: Man City extend with Puma in $1.3B deal
content: Manchester City have signed a 10-year contract extension with kit manufacturer Puma that will take their partnership to 2035, the club announced on Tuesday.

title: Source: Liverpool reject Bayern bid for Díaz
content: Liverpool have rejected a €67.5 million (£58.6m) bid from Bayern Munich to sign forward Luis Diaz, a source told ESPN.

title: Atlético reach deal to sign Argentina's Almada
content: Atlético Madrid have reached an agreement with Botafogo to sign Thiago Almada, the LaLiga club announced Tuesday.

title: Reports: Spanish agencies want Yamal party probe
content: Spain's Ministry for Social Rights has requested an investigation into possible breaches of disability laws at Barcelona star Lamine Yamal's 18th birthday party, according to EFE.

title: Man United lay Diogo Jota tribute at Anfield
content: Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes, Diogo Dalot and coach Ruben Amorim were at Anfield on Monday to pay tribute to compatriots Diogo Jota and his brother André Silva.

title: Euro 2025 Power Rankings: Spain still the favorite, England a close second
content: Euro 2025 is down to the final eight teams who have the chance to get their hands on the trophy in Switzerland. We ranked them in order.

title: Year 2 player spotlight: Maye, Harrison, Odunze among popular breakouts
content: The ESPN Fantasy staff lists NFL sophomores who are undervalued in drafts and others who are under scrutiny.

title: Behind the scenes with a heavyweight champion
content: ESPN goes behind the scenes in camp with Oleksandr Usyk ahead of his undisputed heavyweight title fight against Daniel Dubois on July 19.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United linked with Lyon midfielder Tolisso
content: Lyon midfielder Corentin Tolisso has emerged as a transfer target for Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Tillman to Leverkusen: Can USMNT star fill void left by Wirtz?
content: Malik Tillman is coming off a career year and Bayer Leverkusen are in transition. Is this a perfect match?

title: Flower Power! Wrexham unveil bright new 2025-26 away kit
content: Wrexham's new away kit takes its inspiration from the daffodil, the flower which serves as a national symbol of pride and optimism for Wales.

title: Will back-to-back-to-back promotions catch up with them?
content: Wrexham has vaulted to within a step shy of the Prem. Are they ready for the Championship's punishing schedule?

title: 'Call Putin': Nato threatens sanctions on India, China, Brazil
content: Nato secretary general Mark Rutte has warned India, China, and Brazil of potential secondary sanctions due to their ongoing trade relations with Russia. Rutte urged these nations to pressure Vladimir Putin to engage seriously in peace negotiations with Ukraine, emphasizing that failure to do so could have significant economic repercussions for them.

title: Bomb scare: 2 Delhi schools receive threats
content: Delhi's St. Thomas School and Vasant Valley School in Dwarka received bomb threats via email, prompting an immediate investigation. The Fire Department swiftly responded and conducted thorough searches of both premises. Authorities have not discovered any suspicious items or devices thus far.

title: Fauja Singh hit-and-run: NRI arrested over death of oldest marathon runner
content: Punjab police have apprehended a suspect in connection with the hit-and-run incident that resulted in the death of Fauja Singh, the world's oldest marathon runner. The 113-year-old athlete was struck by a vehicle on the Jalandhar-Pathankot highway. Investigations involving CCTV footage and eyewitness accounts led to the identification of the vehicle and subsequent arrest.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: Trump 'on nobody's side'; distances himself from Putin
content: Donald Trump has expressed a desire to end the Russia-Ukraine war, stating his allegiance lies with humanity and calling for an immediate cessation of hostilities. Trump voiced disappointment in Vladimir Putin, claiming the Russian leader's actions contradict their previous conversations.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla returns safely, next mission: Helping Gaganyaan
content: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla concluded his Axiom-4 mission with a splashdown in the Pacific, marking a significant step in India's human spaceflight program. Following months of training and experiments on the ISS, Shux's return was celebrated by PM Modi as inspiration for India's Gaganyaan mission. The Dragon capsule's re-entry and recovery were successful, with the crew undergoing medical checks before debriefing.

title: Tesla India launch: Anand Mahindra's message to Elon Musk; says ‘Meet you at …’
content: Anand Mahindra welcomed Elon Musk and Tesla to India as the EV company officially debuted with its first showroom, the Tesla Experience Centre, in Mumbai. Mahindra expressed optimism and acknowledged the competition Tesla brings to India's growing EV sector. Tesla has launched its Model Y in India, with prices starting at Rs 61 lakh.

title: Cricket: BCCI VP presents King Charles III with book on partition; reveals conversation with the monarch
content: King Charles III met the Indian men's and women's cricket teams at St. James's Palace, displaying detailed knowledge of the players' lives and recent matches. The BCCI Vice President highlighted the King's humility and interest in cricket, including the Lord's Test. Players and coaches expressed their delight at the meeting, with discussions covering match details and future prospects.

title: ‘Going to have access into..’: Trump shares update on India-US trade deal
content: US President Trump announced the US is pursuing a trade agreement with India, aiming for greater access to Indian markets, similar to the deal struck with Indonesia. Indian commerce ministry officials are currently in the US for trade talks, with expectations of reduced tariffs for India.

title: ‘Carefully consider…’: Indian embassy in Iran issues fresh advisory
content: Amid escalating regional tensions and recent military actions involving Israel, Iran, and the United States, the Indian Embassy in Iran has advised Indian nationals against non-essential travel to the country. The embassy urges those already in Iran to remain vigilant, monitor developments, and consider returning via available commercial options, echoing similar warnings from the US regarding travel safety.

title: Goldman Sachs hires a new employee that could be a 'nightmare' for engineering graduates
content: Goldman Sachs is set to revolutionize its software development by integrating Devin, an AI software engineer, aiming to enhance productivity and automate routine tasks. This move signals a significant shift in the financial industry's labor dynamics, potentially impacting entry-level positions as AI coders become integral to the workforce.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for July 16; check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares suggests buying Tilak Nagar Industries, Orchid Pharma, and ITC. Tilak Nagar Industries shows range breakout with volume support. Orchid Pharma indicates potential breakout after downtrend. ITC displays renewed strength with an Inverse Head and Shoulders pattern.

title: Will bring Pahalgam attackers to justice: EAM Jaishankar at SCO
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar addressed the SCO meeting, condemning the Pahalgam attack as an attempt to destabilize J&K's economy and incite religious division. He urged the SCO to adopt a firm stance against terrorism, emphasizing India's commitment to bringing the perpetrators to justice. Jaishankar also highlighted the need for regional stability in Afghanistan and improved transit within the SCO region.

title: Yogita Bihani: Aaryamann Sethi’s girlfriend who worked with Hrithik Roshan, Anil Kapoor
content: Aaryamann Sethi, son of Archana Puran Singh, revealed his relationship with Yogita Bihani. He surprised her during a shoot in Hyderabad. The couple met on the set of 'Chhoti Baatein'. Yogita has worked in 'The Kerala Story' and other projects. She was surprised by Aaryamann's announcement. She confirmed that she is dating Aaryamann. Fans are excited about this news.

title: 'We will revoke your US Visa and deport you immediately if you Do Not ...': US Embassy in India
content: The US Embassy in India has issued a stern warning to visa holders, emphasizing that scrutiny continues even after visa issuance. Authorities continuously monitor compliance with US laws and immigration rules, with potential consequences including visa revocation and deportation for violations.

title: Trump announces new deal with Indonesia at reduced 19% tariff rate
content: Donald Trump announced a new trade agreement with Indonesia, significantly reducing tariffs on Indonesian exports to 19% and granting full market access to American goods. Indonesia has committed to purchasing billions in US energy, agricultural products, and Boeing jets.

title: Pakistani drones back, pushing drugs & guns into India
content: Following Operation Sindoor, Pakistani smugglers have adapted, now deploying advanced drones that penetrate deeper into Indian territory, up to 2.5km, to deliver drugs, arms, and ammunition. BSF DIG AK Vidyarthi notes the increased precision of these intrusions. Smugglers are using Chinese drones and flying at higher altitudes to evade detection, exploiting the limitations of current Indian anti-drone technology.

title: Mark Zuckerberg doubles down after Rs 800 crore salary to Trapit Bansal with Rs 1,600 crore package to Apple AI exec
content: Mark Zuckerberg is aggressively pursuing AI dominance, assembling a 'dream team' for Meta's Superintelligence Lab. He's offering record-breaking packages, from Rs 800 crore to over Rs 1,600 crore, to poach top AI minds from rivals like Apple and OpenAI. This initiative aims to unify Meta's AI projects, striving for superintelligence, surpassing even AGI.

title: Rookie cheerleader Cooper Maas quickly becomes Cowboys fan favorite
content: Cooper Maas, recognised for her role in 'Reacher', now shines as a Dallas Cowboys cheerleader. Her Instagram posts about resilience resonate with fans. Maas's journey inspires many. The Cowboys also announced cheer squad leaders Kleine Powell, Anna Kate Sundvold, and Karley Swindell. While the Cowboys aim for playoffs, Maas's popularity offers a refreshing story. Her story is winning hearts.

title: Don Cherry comments on immigrants; Ron MacLean calls it an orchestrated exit strategy
content: Don Cherry was fired from Hockey Night in Canada in 2019 for controversial comments about immigrants and Remembrance Day poppies. Ron MacLean, his former co-host, suggested Cherry's remarks were a deliberate exit strategy following a pneumonia scare. Cherry denies MacLean's claims, expressing disappointment and stating he has no desire to discuss the matter further with MacLean.

title: NHL trade buzz: McDavid weighs Oilers loyalty; eyes free agency freedom
content: Elliotte Friedman suggests Connor McDavid is likely to sign a contract extension with the Edmonton Oilers, securing his future with the team beyond the 2025-26 season. Despite recent playoff heartbreaks and speculation about McDavid exploring free agency, the Oilers' captain seems committed to chasing a Stanley Cup in Edmonton. Negotiations for a lucrative contract extension are expected.

title: In UK, tributes pour in for Fauja Singh after his death in Punjab
content: Fauja Singh, the world's oldest marathon runner, passed away at 114 after a car accident in his Punjab village. Tributes pour in from across the UK, remembering him as an inspiring figure who promoted physical activity and Sikh identity.

title: Is Tom Brady backing Trump? NFL legend’s Club World Cup appearance fuels speculation
content: Tom Brady's appearance at a soccer match in Donald Trump's suite has reignited discussions about his political leanings. This event, coupled with past incidents like the MAGA hat sighting, fuels speculation despite Brady's attempts to remain neutral. Antonio Brown's claims of Brady's support for Trump further complicate the narrative, even though Brady has never officially endorsed any candidate.

title: 5 years ahead of target, India gets 50% power from clean sources
content: India has achieved a significant milestone, with non-fossil fuel sources now constituting half of its 484.8 GW power generation capacity, five years ahead of its Paris Agreement target. Renewable energy, including large hydel projects, accounts for 234 GW, complemented by 8.7 GW of nuclear capacity.

title: Michael Jordan and Yvette Prieto turn heads in Greece aboard luxury yacht
content: Michael Jordan and his wife, Yvette Prieto, are enjoying a luxurious Mediterranean summer aboard their $115 million yacht, M’Brace. They've been spotted in glamorous locations like Mykonos, with Yvette showcasing her impeccable vacation style. Jordan is also preparing for a broadcast comeback with NBC after selling his stake in the Charlotte Hornets, marking a new chapter in his career.

title: Creating fear to stop people helping law is a terror act: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court addressed a remission plea. It involved a convict in a J&K case. The court stated creating fear is a terror act. This applies even if anti-terror laws are not used. The case involved killing an army informer. The court expressed reservations about granting remission. The J&K government opposed remission under its policy.

title: Bihar: Contact voters individually to complete forms under SIR - Election Commission
content: Bihar's Election Commission is intensifying efforts to finalize the electoral roll, achieving 91% coverage after accounting for deceased and relocated voters. Booth level officers will contact remaining electors to ensure timely form submission.

title: Portrait believed to be only one Gandhi sat for sells for Rs 1.7 crore at Bonhams
content: A rare oil painting of Mahatma Gandhi by British artist Clare Leighton fetched £152,800 (Rs 1.7 crore) at a Bonhams online auction. The portrait, believed to be the only one Gandhi ever sat for, tripled its estimate. Leighton met Gandhi in London in 1931 during the Second Round Table Conference.

title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ BO collection: Film slows down; mints Rs 80 lakh on 4th Tuesday
content: Aamir Khan and Genelia Deshmukh's 'Sitaare Zameen Par,' a sports drama about a suspended coach training a team of neurodivergent players, has grossed Rs 162 crore after 26 days. While weekday collections have dipped, weekends remain strong, indicating continued audience interest. Reviews praise the film's heart and humor but note pacing issues and unnecessary subplots.

title: CS2 Premier Season 3: Everything you need to know
content: CS2 Premier Season 2 has concluded, and Season 3 is on the horizon, bringing anticipated changes to the game. Players can expect a ratings reset, requiring placement matches, and potential updates to the Active Duty Map Pool, with maps like Cobblestone or Cache possibly making a return. Furthermore, improvements to the anti-cheat system, potentially VACnet 3.

title: Using social media to spread radical ideology invites UAPA: Delhi high court
content: The Delhi High Court has ruled that disseminating radical ideology on social media, even without a physical act of terror, can fall under UAPA provisions. This decision came as the court denied bail to an operative of "The Resistance Front (TRF)", citing his online activities of posting terrorist photos and inciting violence.

title: Difference between Fatty Liver Grade 1 and Grade 2: Four point formula to reverse both
content: Hepatic steatosis or fatty liver disease, occurs when liver tissue contains more than 5-10% fat by weight. Fatty liver disease emerges from excessive alcohol consumption (alcoholic fatty liver disease) and weight-related conditions, including diabetes and unhealthy eating (non-alcoholic fatty liver disease)

title: Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani welcome a baby girl, mother and child healthy
content: It’s a moment of joy for Bollywood’s beloved couple, Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani, as they have welcomed their first child, a baby girl. The couple, who are yet to make an official announcement, became parents earlier this week in Mumbai. A source said that the baby was born via normal delivery at Reliance Hospital in Mumbai and both the mother and daughter are healthy.

title: Time for a law to compensate persons acquitted after long incarceration: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court acquitted a man previously sentenced to death for a 2011 double murder in Kerala, citing a flawed investigation and lack of evidence. The court highlighted the unprofessional handling of the DNA tests and suggested Parliament consider compensating those wrongly incarcerated, drawing inspiration from foreign jurisdictions. Guidelines were issued to improve police handling of forensic evidence.

title: Assam CM vows to end 'invasion' by 'one religion'
content: Assam has recovered 160 sq km of land from illegal Muslim settlers, an area larger than Chandigarh, in a four-year effort to protect the state's demography and indigenous communities. Chief Minister Sarma stated the evictions, targeting 1.

title: Organiser: Go back to original Preamble sans 'socialist' and 'secular'
content: The 'Organiser' magazine advocates for removing 'socialist' and 'secular' from the Constitution. It terms these words as 'ideological landmines'. The magazine claims these terms were inserted during the Emergency. It alleges this insertion was a 'constitutional fraud'. The article urges a return to the original Preamble. It emphasizes restoring constitutional honesty. The magazine argues India is a 'dharmic civilization'.

title: Government to crack down on unapproved biostimulants' sale
content: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has raised concerns about the unregulated sale of biostimulants lacking scientific validation. He questioned the efficacy of these products and directed officials to ensure strict regulations, mandating scientific evaluation by ICAR for approval. Chouhan emphasized that only biostimulants proven effective will be permitted, holding officials accountable for the approval process.

title: SC upholds life term for murder but asks governor to consider remission plea
content: A recent 'honeymoon murder' in Meghalaya mirrors a 2003 case where a woman and her lover were convicted for killing her fiancé. The Supreme Court, while upholding the life sentence, reflected on the societal pressures driving women to such crimes.

title: Quinshon Judkins rookie arrest: Chilling 911 call surfaces; Browns rookie charge
content: Cleveland Browns rookie Quinshon Judkins faces a misdemeanor battery charge after allegedly assaulting his girlfriend. A newly released 911 call reveals the woman's distress, detailing visible bruises and ongoing pain from the incident. The Browns acknowledge the allegations and are gathering information, leaving Judkins' NFL future uncertain amidst the legal proceedings and scrutiny over player conduct.

title: Shux’s mission validates India’s astronaut selection & training: Former IAM chief
content: Air Vice Marshal Anupam Agarwal highlights Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's mission to the ISS as crucial for validating India's astronaut training protocols. This mission tests the effectiveness of aerospace medicine processes and psychological selection methods in real microgravity conditions. IAM's role extends to collecting vital physiological data, essential for understanding microgravity's impact on Indian astronauts and refining future mission preparations.

title: Cheap politics, says Dharmendra Pradhan as Rahul claims 'murder by BJP system'
content: The BJP has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi for politicizing the self-immolation of an Odisha student, labeling his accusations as "cheap politics." Gandhi had called the death a "murder by BJP system," alleging inaction on sexual harassment.

title: Delhi fire tragedy: Two killed, two injured in late-night blaze in Old Govindpura
content: A devastating fire in Delhi's Old Govindpura area of Jagatpuri claimed the lives of two individuals, Tanveer and Nusrat, while injuring two others, Faizal and Aasif. The blaze, which erupted in a residential building, trapped around ten people, prompting a swift response from police and fire brigade personnel who rescued six individuals.

title: Cookie Johnson supports noble cause; posts heartfelt message post-vacation
content: Cookie Johnson, wife of NBA legend Magic Johnson, is partnering with the Elizabeth Taylor AIDS Foundation as the 2025 ETAF Champion. She aims to advocate for a world free from AIDS, continuing Elizabeth Taylor's vision. The announcement was made via Instagram, inviting fans to join the Elizabeth Taylor Night of Compassion on September 18, 2025.

title: Trump’s Epstein dilemma: When conspiracist-in-chief can’t kill the conspiracy
content: Donald Trump faces growing discontent from his MAGA base over the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein case. The Justice Department's closure of the case, without revealing a client list, has fueled accusations of a cover-up. This has led to prominent MAGA figures questioning Trump's commitment to exposing elite corruption, potentially impacting his support and future political prospects.

title: Siraj finally breaks silence following gut-wrenching loss at Lord's, says 'not for ... '
content: Mohammed Siraj expressed his emotions after India's narrow defeat at Lord's, highlighting the lessons learned despite the disappointing outcome. His resilient batting alongside Ravindra Jadeja offered a glimmer of hope during a tense final stand, but Siraj's unfortunate dismissal ended India's chase.

title: Swift, Kelce ditch Blake Lively; grow closer to Selena Gomez ahead of her wedding
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are reportedly set to attend Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco's wedding in September. This news surfaces amid speculation that Swift has distanced herself from Blake Lively following Lively's involvement in a legal issue with Justin Baldoni. Swift is reportedly spending her time working on music, relaxing with Kelce, and spending time with family.

title: Trump tariff war: Deal or no deal - why it won’t matter much for India
content: India and the US are engaged in fast-paced talks for an interim trade deal, with the tariff rate being a key point of negotiation. Despite potential challenges from a less favorable deal, India has avenues to diversify its exports, particularly in services.

title: Joy Taylor breaks silence; responds to FOX Sports firing
content: Joy Taylor faces backlash after her FOX Sports contract wasn't renewed amidst allegations of inappropriate relationships with colleagues. She posted a workout video on Instagram, drawing harsh criticism and accusations related to her career advancement. Several other FOX Sports shows, including "Breakfast Ball" and "The Facility," have also been cancelled recently.

title: Woman delivers baby on running bus; newborn thrown out, dies
content: A pedestrian noticed the baby being thrown out the window; the couple told the police that they dumped the newborn as they were unable to raise the child

title: ICDS workers in West Bengal protest against delay in meeting demands including budget allocation
content: They held protest rallies in Kolkata demanding increased budget allocation in the nutrition sector and job security

title: TVK general secretary Aadhav Arjuna alleges threat to his life
content: Mr. Arjuna alleged that a series of suspicious incidents took place on July 10 outside his office on Kasthuri Rangan Road, Alwarpet.

title: Centre responded positively to Tourism Bhavan project at Amaravati, says A.P. Minister Kandula Durgesh
content: Kandula Durgesh asks officials to promote tourism destinations in the State by conducting road shows in Hyderabad, Bengaluru, Chennai, Kolkata and Mumbai

title: Mamata accuses Centre of denying flood relief funds to West Bengal
content: She says Assam gets aid while West Bengal battles floods from DVC reservoirs water release; DVC denies allegations of unplanned water release

title: NCP-SP appoints Shashikant Shinde as new State president, succeeding Jayant Patil
content: After the poor performance at the 2024 Assembly elections, Mr. Patil expressed his desire to resign and hand over to a new leader

title: No need for more technocrats, IIT Kharagpur to focus on human-centric R&D, says Director
content: Newly appointed Director of IIT Kharagpur, Dr Suman Chakraborty, said at the convocation that the institute is focused on multi-disciplinary, human-centric AI and STEM research

title: Fauja Singh hit-and-run case: SUV driver arrested
content: Earlier in the day, some villagers said that it was probably an SUV which struck Fauja Singh in a hit-and-run incident

title: CM Mamata urges Bangladesh Govt to protect ancestral home of Satyajit Ray in Mymensingh
content: The West Bengal Chief Minister noted that the ancestral home of Satyajit Ray’s family, which is closely associated with his grandfather, the renowned writer and editor Upendrakishore Ray Chowdhury, is apparently being demolished.

title: When the Tamil Nadu Professional Courses Entrance Examination came under fire
content: In 2004, Anna University, the nodal agency which was tasked with conducting the TNPCEE on behalf of the State government since its inception in 1984, decided to not value 22 questions in different subjects

title: The two bye-elections fought by Congress leader Kamaraj in Tamil Nadu
content: Commenting on the late Chief Minister’s electoral battles, A. Gopanna, who had also authored his biography, feels Kamaraj always attached greater emphasis on drawing support from the people directly

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Naidu defends Hindi in schools, says P.V. Narasimha Rao, a scholar in 17 languages, is an example
content: He was a true ‘Telugu Bidda’ who reshaped the destiny of our great nation, and we are enjoying the fruits of the reforms he initiated, asserts the Chief Minister

title: Madras and India’s oldest hockey tournament
content: The Madras Cricket Club, established in 1846, was the venue where many sports that we take for granted today were first played in Chennai city. Hockey was one among them.

title: Press bodies express concern over FIR lodged against Ajit Anjum
content: Lodging a case against him raises serious questions about the freedom of the press and mounting challenges to free expression in a democratic set up

title: Maharashtra Health Department to set up committee for effective leprosy eradication
content: An independent committee to determine the working methods for patient search campaigns, treatment, and rehabilitation will be formed to monitor the leprosy eradication programme at the State-level

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu to release water from expanded Handri-Neeva Phase-1 canal on July 17
content: The canal is expected to facilitate transfer of water up to Jeedipalli Reservoir and beyond; it is expected to address the drinking water and irrigation needs of Rayalaseema, covering parts of Kurnool, Anantapur, Chittoor, and Kadapa districts

title: TDP seeks procedural clarity, safeguards against wrongful deletions in electoral roll management
content: TDP, in a representation to the Election Commission of India, proposes a series of reforms to ensure timely, inclusive, and tech-driven voter roll revisions

title: NATO chief says India, Brazil, and China could be slammed by sanctions
content: Republican U.S. Senator Thom Tillis praised Mr. Trump for announcing the steps, but said the 50-day delay "worries" him.

title: India offers to help Bangladesh restore Satyajit Ray’s home
content: MEA expresses regret over demolition plans, asks Dhaka to reconsider destroying “shared cultural history”

title: Not demonising Mughal rulers in textbooks: NCERT social science panel head
content: “Akbar himself admits he was brutal in his younger days. We are not demonising Akbar or Aurangzeb, but we have to show these rulers had their limitations and committed cruel deeds,” Michel Danino, Head, NCERT’s Curricular Area Group for Social Science, told The Hindu.

title: Govt. to explore GenAI to simplify administration
content: Kerala has immense potential for innovation owing to its progressive social climate that encourages free thinking and scientific consciousness, says Minister

title: Avoid speculation on Air India crash, says global pilots’ body
content: This comes days after the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) submitted its preliminary findings into the Boeing 787 crash in Ahmedabad in which 260 people died

title: Fact-finding team inspects sealed private dental clinic in Vaniyambadi
content: Unsterile dental practices at the clinic allegedly led to the death of eight patients in May 2023. During the hour-long inspection, the team also interacted with doctors, nurses, and other staff, who worked in the clinic before its closure

title: 12 govt. schools to get copies of The Hindu In School for academic year
content: Supported by the Manappuram Foundation, the initiative aims at boosting students’ English language skills

title: Maharashtra Woman Delivers Baby On Running Bus, Then Throws Him Out
content: A 19-year-old woman gave birth to a baby on board a running sleeper coach bus in Maharashtra's Parbhani, but she and a man claiming to be her husband threw the newborn out of the window, leading to the child's death, police have said.

title: Chandrababu Naidu Wades Into Language Debate With A Narasimha Rao Example
content: Amid the ongoing language debate, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu on Tuesday said former prime minister PV Narasimha Rao knew 17 languages, including Hindi.

title: "Not Welcome Here": Another Canadian Leader Seeks Terror Tag For Bishnoi Gang
content: The Premier of the Canadian province of Alberta has urged the federal government to designate the notorious Lawrence Bishnoi gang a terrorist organisation, joining a string of leaders to make such a request.

title: NRI From Canada Arrested In Iconic Runner Fauja Singh Hit-And-Run Case
content: The man who allegedly rammed his car into 114-year-old marathon runner Fauja Singh on the Jalandhar-Pathankot highway has been arrested, police said on Wednesday.

title: Sole Occupant Hijacks Small Plane, Arrested After Landing In Vancouver
content: Travel at one of Canada's busiest airports was briefly halted Tuesday after federal police received a report that a small plane had been "hijacked," officials said.

title: Air India To 'Partially Restore' International Flights Effective August 1
content: Air India has announced a phased resumption of its international operations following a "safety pause" implemented after the tragic crash of flight AI171 on June 12.

title: Explained: The Epstein Files, Conspiracy Theories And What's Next
content: A perceived lack of transparency over the US investigations into notorious sex offender Jeffrey Epstein has carved a rare chasm between President Donald Trump and his typically loyal Republican base.

title: "Pretty Boring Stuff": Donald Trump On Jeffrey Epstein Case
content: Donald Trump is facing the most serious split of his political career from his famously loyal right-wing base over suspicions that his administration is covering up lurid details of Jeffrey Epstein's crimes.

title: "If You Live In Beijing Or Delhi...": NATO Chief's Warning Over Russia Trade
content: Mark Rutte's comment came a day after Donald Trump threatened "biting" secondary tariffs of 100% on the buyers of Russian exports unless there is a peace deal in 50 days.

title: Why Prince Harry Is In Angola, Repeating Mother Diana's 1997 Trip
content: Prince Harry visited the African nation of Angola on Tuesday with a land mine clearing charity, repeating a famous trip his mother made in 1997.

title: Punjab Police Foil Killing Plot, 5 Linked Of Bhagwanpuria Gang Arrested
content: In a significant breakthrough, Punjab Police have foiled a targeted killing plot with the arrest of five operatives linked to the Jaggu Bhagwanpuria gang, being operated by US-based Husandeep Singh, said Director General of Police (DGP) on Tuesday.

title: Mike Waltz Vows To Make UN "Great Again" At Senate Confirmation Hearing
content: Mike Waltz painted an image for lawmakers Tuesday of what the United Nations would look like as the U.S.  its largest donor  reviews its support, opting to go "back to basics" under a Trump administration push to "make the U.N. great again."

title: Pentagon Ends Deployment Of 2,000 National Guard In Los Angeles
content: The Pentagon said Tuesday it is ending the deployment of 2,000 National Guard troops in Los Angeles, accounting for nearly half of the soldiers sent to the city to deal with protests over the Trump administration's immigration crackdown.

title: US, Allies Agree August Deadline For Iran Nuclear Deal: Report
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and the foreign ministers of France, Germany and the UK agreed in a phone call on Monday to set the end of August as the de facto deadline for reaching a nuclear deal with Iran, Axios reported, citing three sources.

title: "Going To Have Access": Trump Amid India-US Trade Talks
content: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday said the United States is close to securing full trade access into India. He also announced a new trade deal with Indonesia, after which the latter will face a reduced tariff rate of 19 per cent.

title: BRS Urges Poll Body To Delete Certain Symbols Resembling Party's "Car"
content: BRS Leaders Boinipally Vinod Kumar and Soma Bharat Kumar met the State Election Commissioner on Tuesday seeking deletion of certain identical symbols from the list of free symbols as they are similar to BRS' "Car".

title: India Advises Citizens To Avoid Non-Essential Travel To Iran
content: The Indian Embassy in Iran issued a travel advisory on Wednesday, urging Indian nationals to avoid non-essential travel to Iran.

title: Trump Says Ukraine Should Not Target Moscow
content: US President Donald Trump said Tuesday that Ukraine should not target Moscow, after the Kremlin charged that a new US plan to supply weapons to Kyiv along with sanctions threats against Russia would delay peace efforts.

title: China To Hold SCO Summit In Tianjin From Aug 31 To Sept 1: Wang Yi
content: Leaders from more than 20 countries and heads of 10 international organisations will attend the Tianjin Summit of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) and related events next month, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said on Tuesday.

title: Man Kills 4-Year-Old Stepdaughter In Mumbai, Dumps Body In Sea
content: A 40-year-old man allegedly killed his five-year-old stepdaughter in Mumbai by strangulating her and dumped the body in the Arabian Sea, police said on Tuesday.

title: Bihar Cabinet approves one crore jobs, employment opportunities in next five years
content: The cabinet also decided to give a one time honorarium of ₹6000 to 77,895 Booth Level Officers (BLOs) and 8245 BLO Supervisors for carrying out Special Intensive Revision (SIR) electoral roll in the state.

title: Suffered in silence for the past eight months: Omar Abdullah
content: The J&K CM was referring to the L-G administration’s security measures to stop the Chief Minister and Ministers from visiting the graveyard where 22 civilians, killed during the 1931 uprising against the Dogra ruler, are buried

title: CPI leader shot dead in Hyderabad: Locals recall panic as gunshots shatter daily calm
content: Local resident says the body remained at the crime scene for over half an hour despite the Urban Primary Health Centre being just a few steps away

title: Bombay High Court dismisses petition against Rahul Gandhi over remarks on Savarkar
content: The petitioner asks the court to direct Gandhi to learn about Savarkar by reading his plea which including his own research on the Hindutva idealogue

title: 95 firms propose to invest ₹1 lakh crore in Andhra Pradesh, says Lokesh
content: Urges authorities to expedite issue of necessary permissions and facilitate infrastructure so that these firms can quickly establish their operations

title: BJP celebrates CAT order on Urdu clause for Naib-Tehsildar posts in J&K
content: PDP terms ruling ‘a blow to linguistic heritage’; JKSSB defers application process following tribunal decision

title: Air India to progressively restore international flights stopped after June 12 crash
content: The airline had curtailed 15% of its international flights as DGCA did safety checks on its Boeing 787-8 fleet; fuel control switch locks checked in 50% of fleet; full restoration of flight schedule by October 1

title: Government data show fall in number of women at work in rural, urban areas
content: Govt. says this may be due to seasonal agricultural patterns and intense summer heat limiting outdoor work; unemployment rate stagnant at 5.6% for the second month in a row

title: U.P. committed to skilling youth for self-reliant India, says Yogi Adityanath
content: Chief Minister inaugurates two-day Skill Fair in Lucknow, flags off outreach chariots and hands out awards on World Youth Skills Day

title: Congress to focus on Pahalgam terror attack in first week of Monsoon Session of Parliament
content: The party leadership will reach out to other constituents of INDIA bloc and explore the possibility of holding a meeting on July 19/20 to finalise a common agenda

title: Anbumani’s July 20 protest may dent chances of patch-up with Ramadoss
content: Sources say the protest planned by Dr. Anbumani in Villupuram  is likely to prevent any chance of rapprochement because 50,000 workers are being mobilised

title: Shubhanshu Shukla undergoing post-mission medical evaluation, says ISRO
content: The evaluation is to last seven days and include cardiovascular assessments, musculoskeletal tests, and psychological debriefs

title: Maharashtra releases water from Koyna dam
content: Water levels in the Krishna recedes as rainfall quantum reduces in parts of Karnataka and Maharashtra

title: Tenders invited for 16.7 km Twin Tunnel Project linking Hebbal and Silk Board
content: According to the tender notice, the construction period has been set at 50 months, equivalent to four years and two months

title: ANRF unveils PM Professorships to bolster research in State universities
content: Fellowships open to overseas scientists; recipients to mentor faculty at institutions with emerging research capacity

title: SCO shouldn’t compromise on terrorism: Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister says Pahalgam attack was carried out to ‘sow religious divide’; SCO was founded to combat terrorism, separatism and extremism, he tells counterparts at meet in China

title: How IPR applications by Mother Teresa varsity faculty are helping Kodaikanal tribespeople
content: Usha Raja Nanthini, Professor and Head, Biotechnology Dept., has filed 150 separate applications under industrial design for jewellery made with naturally-occurring seeds

title: 675 under observation for Nipah in Kerala
content: While 210 of those under observation are in Malappuram district, 347 are in Palakkad, 115 in Kozhikode, two in Ernakulam and one in Thrissur

title: Congress draws parallels between the NRC, and the SIR in Bihar
content: The Special Intensive Revision should not be about verifying citizenship, which is the purview of the Ministry of Home Affairs, Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar said

title: KHSTU writes to Bindu seeking discussions on marks normalisation
content: Decisions taken without any discussions on issues as normalisation had led to change in candidates’ ranks, putting students under immense stress, according to KHSTU

title: UIDAI urges parents of children between five and seven to update Aadhaar biometrics
content: Updating biometrics of children below the age of seven is necessary for Aadhaar as children up to the age of five don’t have their biometrics captured, UIDAI said

title: BJP Scheduled Castes Morcha demands resignation of Allamprabhu Patil
content: The demand comes in the wake of the arrest of an aide of the Kalaburagi South MLA in a drugs case by the Maharashtra Police

title: Naidu seeks Centre’s support for Polavaram–Banakacherla interlinking project in Andhra Pradesh
content: CM says project will solve Rayalaseema’s water woes; thanks Modi govt for appointing Ashok Gajapathi Raju as Governor

title: Police shoot at, injure two accused as they try to flee after attacking them in Vijayapura
content: Superintendent of Police says investigation is on to arrest four others in connection with a murder case

title: Shot to death in Malakpet
content: A sense of fear gripped Shalivahana Nagar, a residential colony in Malakpet here after gunfire shattered the early morning calm on Tuesday. The incident was reported around 7:20 a.m., just outside Shalivahana Nagar Park, where Communist Party of India (CPI) State Council member Chandu Naik, 47, was shot dead during morning walk.

title: Mbappé, Yamal, and Pelé lead EA FC 25 FUTTIES Team 1
content: FUTTIES is the next Ultimate Team program in EA Sports FC 25 . Kylian Mbappé , Lamine Yamal , and Pelé all sport 99 OVR . the real madrid striker features 99 in Pace and Dribbling and 97 in Shooting .

title: Reconsider demolition of Satyajit Ray's ancestral home: India to Bangladesh
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics.

title: 2025 MLB draft tracker: Day 2 pick-by-pick results and Day 1 analysis
content: all 20 rounds of the 2025 MLB draft are in the books . the Washington Nationals select shortstop Eli Willits with the no. 1 overall pick . college pitcher Tyler Bremner and the Seattle Mariners nabbed another in Kade Anderson .

title: Bam Margera on returning to Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4, life and rehab
content: the former "Jackass" star is back to appear in Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 . he says his legs were too damaged to skate . his legs are 45, and they feel like they're 2 .

title: New rules for EBUGs? 84 games? What to know about the NHL's new CBA
content: the current CBA runs through the end of the 2025-26 season . the new CBA is set to begin on sept. 16, 2026 and runs through Sept. 15, 2030 . it would make the fastest both sides have reached an extension in Gary Bettman's tenure .

title: Favorite (and surprising) Day 1 MLB draft picks -- and Day 2's top names
content: the nationals select shortstop Eli Willits with the first overall pick of the 2025 MLB draft . it's time to look at which picks in the first round stood out most . some of the picks we aren't quite sure about on Day 1 will become clearer .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Takeaways from the Home Run Derby in Atlanta
content: Cal Raleigh becomes the first catcher to win the 2025 home run Derby . the Seattle Mariners slugger outlasted junior Caminero . it was a power-packed night in Atlanta as oneil Cruz hit a ball a whopping 513 feet .

title: Euro 2025 Daily: England thrash Wales and avoid Germany, Spain in bracket
content: the 2025 women's european championship is into the final group games . we will update this file throughout each matchday with the latest reporting, analysis and fun from the competition . for roughly a third of the match, it appeared England were going to top the group (as France were losing 2-1)

title: FIFA reveals details to apply for World Cup tickets
content:
Applications for tickets for the 2026 World Cup open Sept. 10, FIFA said Tuesday. The next edition of the tournament, which will be co-hosted by Canada, Mexico and the United States, kicks off at the Azteca Stadium in Mexico City on June 11. Soccer's world governing body FIFA said that due to anticipated high demand tickets would be released in phases. -  World Cup lessons from Club World Cup 
-  Club World Cup takeaways 
-  Infantino: Covered stadiums to be used at '26 WC It did not say if it would use dynamic pricing, as was the case for the Club World Cup, which saw ticket prices fluctuate wildly. "We're looking forward to welcoming the world back to North America, as Canada, Mexico and the United States host what will be the biggest and greatest sporting event ever," FIFA president Gianni Infantino said in a statement. "We encourage fans everywhere to get ready to secure their place -- these will be the most coveted seats in world sport."

title: Follow live: All-Star Game goes to home run swing-off to determine winner
content: the 2025 MLB All-Star Game has arrived! will the American League continue its dominance over the National League? all-star newcomers, such as Pete Crow-Armstrong, and Aaron Judge will descend on the rest of baseball's best .

title: Buzz: Hansen impresses, Wemby returns and storylines to watch
content: 2025 summer league has been filled with exciting rookie debuts . players looking to secure roster spots and chatter surrounding the season's biggest storylines . our insiders have been on site talking to front office staff and scouts as the future of the league performs ahead of 2025-26 .

title: Who are the NFL's best off-ball linebackers? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank the top 10
content: ESPN surveyed league executives, coaches and scouts to help us rank the top 10 players at 11 different positions . this is the sixth edition of these rankings, and as usual, several players moved up or fell off last year's lists . more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position .

title: 🏆 NFL halftime shows land Emmy nods
content: Kendrick Lamar's halftime show was nominated for four awards at the 77th annual Primetime Emmy Awards on sept. 25 . the halftime performance amassed a record audience of 133.5 million viewers . he also visited some of the most popular hits in his discography .

title: First impressions of the rookie class and other key notes
content: the 2025 draft class hit the floor over the weekend at Las Vegas Summer League . no. 1 pick Cooper Flagg went for 31 points against no. 2 pick Dylan Harper and the San Antonio Spurs . sources confirmed to ESPN's Tim MacMahon that the Mavs will be shutting down Flagg .

title: Can Brian Kelly and LSU win it all?
content: coach Brian Kelly has worked at lSU for more than 35 years . he will join Nick Saban, Les Miles and Ed Orgeron as a national champion . the team has a unique focus taking hold in the weight room .

title: Takeaways: Rating the tournament, best moment, surprise teams, more
content: football has been good, the noise and color from the brazilian and argentina supporters has really brought the tournament to life . the best team in the world (PSG) brought its A-game and really shrouded its crowd numbers .
